perturbation.original_text: TPC agrees to guarantee to Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle a minimum Royalty Compensation of Twenty Thousand U.S. Dollars ($20,000) payable in four (4) equal installments of Five Thousand U.S. Dollars ($5,000) and due simultaneously with the Retainer Fee on or before the first (1st) day of February, May, August and November in each Contract Year.
perturbation.changed_text: TPC may, at its sole discretion, provide Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle a minimum Royalty Compensation, the amount of which will be determined by TPC based on market conditions. Any payment will be made according to a schedule determined solely by TPC.
perturbation.explanation: The original text guarantees a minimum royalty compensation with a fixed schedule. The modified version makes the royalty compensation discretionary and removes any specific payment schedule, contradicting the original guarantee and creating uncertainty about whether any royalty compensation will be paid at all.

perturbation.original_text: Consolidated Artists agrees to cause Ogle to wear a patch and/or an embroidered non-patch bearing the Teardrop name and/or logo on the right chest, left sleeve, and back of his golf shirt and/or sweater (near the collar) and/or rain gear whenever he is playing competitive golf, participating in golf clinics and outings or otherwise engaging in golf promotional activities during the Contract Period and throughout the Contract Territory.
perturbation.changed_text: Consolidated Artists agrees that Ogle will consider wearing a patch and/or embroidered item bearing the Teardrop name and/or logo, but the decision to do so rests solely with Ogle. The location and frequency of wearing such items are also at Ogle's discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates Ogle to wear Teardrop branding during specific activities. The modified text weakens this obligation by making it Ogle's decision, contradicting the original requirement and creating uncertainty about whether the branding will be displayed as agreed.

perturbation.original_text: Said Retainer Fee shall be paid in four (4) equal installments on or before the first (1st) day of February, May, August and November in each Contract Year.
perturbation.changed_text: The Retainer Fee may be paid in installments, with the number, amount, and timing of such installments to be determined at the sole discretion of TPC. TPC is not obligated to adhere to any specific payment schedule.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a fixed payment schedule for the Retainer Fee. The modified text removes this fixed schedule and gives TPC complete discretion over payment, contradicting the original terms and creating uncertainty about when and how the Retainer Fee will be paid.
